datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: fwgrp

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: fwgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: fwgrp

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: fwgrp

options.name: allow

options.name: block
options.help: Block the session when the version is not supported.
options.label: Block

sni-server-cert-check.name: sni-server-cert-check
sni-server-cert-check.help: Check the SNI in the client hello message with the CN or SAN fields in the returned server certificate.

options.name: enable
options.help: Check the SNI in the client hello message with the CN or SAN fields in the returned server certificate. If mismatched, use the CN in the server certificate to do URL filtering.
options.label: Enable

options.name: strict
options.help: Check the SNI in the client hello message with the CN or SAN fields in the returned server certificate. If mismatched, close the connection.
options.label: Strict

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not check the SNI in the client hello message with the CN or SAN fields in the returned server certificate.
options.label: Disable

cert-probe-failure.name: cert-probe-failure
cert-probe-failure.help: Action based on certificate probe failure.

options.name: allow
options.help: Bypass the session when unable to retrieve server's certificate for inspection.
options.label: Allow

options.name: block
options.help: Block the session when unable to retrieve server's certificate for inspection.
options.label: Block

encrypted-client-hello.name: encrypted-client-hello
encrypted-client-hello.help: Block/allow session based on existence of encrypted-client-hello.

options.name: allow
options.help: Pass the session when encrypted-client-hello exists.
options.label: Allow

options.name: block
options.help: Block the session when encrypted-client-hello exists.
options.label: Block

min-allowed-ssl-version.help: Minimum SSL version to be allowed.

client-certificate.help: Action based on received client certificate.

unsupported-ssl-version.name: unsupported-ssl-version
unsupported-ssl-version.help: Action based on the SSL version used being unsupported.

options.name: allow
options.help: Bypass the session when the version is not supported.
options.label: Allow

options.name: block
options.help: Block the session when the version is not supported.
options.label: Block

unsupported-ssl-cipher.name: unsupported-ssl-cipher
unsupported-ssl-cipher.help: Action based on the SSL cipher used being unsupported.

options.name: allow
options.help: Bypass the session when the cipher is not supported.
options.label: Allow

options.name: block
options.help: Block the session when the cipher is not supported.
options.label: Block

unsupported-ssl-negotiation.name: unsupported-ssl-negotiation
unsupported-ssl-negotiation.help: Action based on the SSL negotiation used being unsupported.

options.name: allow
options.help: Bypass the session when the negotiation is not supported.
options.label: Allow

options.name: block
options.help: Block the session when the negotiation is not supported.
options.label: Block

expired-server-cert.name: expired-server-cert
expired-server-cert.help: Action based on server certificate is expired.

options.name: ignore
options.help: Re-sign the server certificate as trusted.
options.label: Ignore

revoked-server-cert.name: revoked-server-cert
revoked-server-cert.help: Action based on server certificate is revoked.

options.name: ignore
options.help: Re-sign the server certificate as trusted.
options.label: Ignore

untrusted-server-cert.name: untrusted-server-cert
untrusted-server-cert.help: Action based on server certificate is not issued by a trusted CA.

options.name: ignore
options.help: Re-sign the server certificate as trusted.
options.label: Ignore

cert-validation-timeout.name: cert-validation-timeout
cert-validation-timeout.help: Action based on certificate validation timeout.

options.name: ignore
options.help: Re-sign the server certificate as trusted.
options.label: Ignore

cert-validation-failure.name: cert-validation-failure
cert-validation-failure.help: Action based on certificate validation failure.

options.name: ignore
options.help: Re-sign the server certificate as trusted.
options.label: Ignore

sni-server-cert-check.name: sni-server-cert-check
sni-server-cert-check.help: Check the SNI in the client hello message with the CN or SAN fields in the returned server certificate.

options.name: enable
options.help: Check the SNI in the client hello message with the CN or SAN fields in the returned server certificate. If mismatched, use the CN in the server certificate to do URL filtering.
options.label: Enable

options.name: strict
options.help: Check the SNI in the client hello message with the CN or SAN fields in the returned server certificate. If mismatched, close the connection.
options.label: Strict

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not check the SNI in the client hello message with the CN or SAN fields in the returned server certificate.
options.label: Disable

allowlist.name: allowlist
allowlist.help: Enable/disable exempting servers by FortiGuard allowlist.

block-blocklisted-certificates.name: block-blocklisted-certificates
block-blocklisted-certificates.help: Enable/disable blocking SSL-based botnet communication by FortiGuard certificate blocklist.

ssl-exempt.name: ssl-exempt
ssl-exempt.help: Servers to exempt from SSL inspection.

type.name: type
type.help: Type of address object (IPv4 or IPv6) or FortiGuard category.

options.name: wildcard-fqdn
options.help: Fully Qualified Domain Name with wildcard characters.
options.label: Wildcard Fqdn

server-cert-mode.name: server-cert-mode
server-cert-mode.help: Re-sign or replace the server's certificate.

options.name: re-sign
options.help: Multiple clients connecting to multiple servers.
options.label: Re Sign
options.description: Multiple clients connecting to multiple servers

use-ssl-server.name: use-ssl-server
use-ssl-server.help: Enable/disable the use of SSL server table for SSL offloading.

caname.name: caname
caname.help: CA certificate used by SSL Inspection.

untrusted-caname.name: untrusted-caname
untrusted-caname.help: Untrusted CA certificate used by SSL Inspection.

server-cert.name: server-cert
server-cert.help: Certificate used by SSL Inspection to replace server certificate.

ssl-server.name: ssl-server
ssl-server.help: SSL server settings used for client certificate request.

ip.name: ip
ip.help: IPv4 address of the SSL server.

https-client-certificate.name: https-client-certificate
https-client-certificate.help: Action based on received client certificate during the HTTPS handshake.

smtps-client-certificate.name: smtps-client-certificate
smtps-client-certificate.help: Action based on received client certificate during the SMTPS handshake.

pop3s-client-certificate.name: pop3s-client-certificate
pop3s-client-certificate.help: Action based on received client certificate during the POP3S handshake.

imaps-client-certificate.name: imaps-client-certificate
imaps-client-certificate.help: Action based on received client certificate during the IMAPS handshake.

ftps-client-certificate.name: ftps-client-certificate
ftps-client-certificate.help: Action based on received client certificate during the FTPS handshake.

ssl-other-client-certificate.name: ssl-other-client-certificate
ssl-other-client-certificate.help: Action based on received client certificate during an SSL protocol handshake.

ssl-negotiation-log.name: ssl-negotiation-log
ssl-negotiation-log.help: Enable/disable logging of SSL negotiation events.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable logging of SSL negotiation events.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable logging of SSL negotiation events

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable logging of SSL negotiation events.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable logging of SSL negotiation events

ssl-server-cert-log.name: ssl-server-cert-log
ssl-server-cert-log.help: Enable/disable logging of server certificate information.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable logging of server certificate information.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable logging of server certificate information

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable logging of server certificate information.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable logging of server certificate information

rpc-over-https.name: rpc-over-https
rpc-over-https.help: Enable/disable inspection of RPC over HTTPS.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable inspection of RPC over HTTPS.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable inspection of RPC over HTTPS

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable inspection of RPC over HTTPS.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable inspection of RPC over HTTPS

mapi-over-https.name: mapi-over-https
mapi-over-https.help: Enable/disable inspection of MAPI over HTTPS.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable inspection of MAPI over HTTPS.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable inspection of MAPI over HTTPS

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable inspection of MAPI over HTTPS.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable inspection of MAPI over HTTPS

options.name: http1-1
options.help: Enable all ALPN including HTTP1.1 except HTTP2 and SPDY.
options.label: Http1 1

options.name: http2
options.help: Enable all ALPN including HTTP2 except HTTP1.1 and SPDY.
options.label: Http2
options.description: Enable all ALPN including HTTP2 except HTTP1

options.name: all
options.help: Allow all ALPN extensions except SPDY.
options.label: All
options.description: Allow all ALPN extensions except SPDY
